# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia function to add a new column with year and month concatenated. This function uses the built-in `Dates` module of Julia which provides functions for manipulating dates and times:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it, where each value is the year of the corresponding date in `dt` concatenated with the month, separated by a hyphen. The `map` function applies a function (in this case, extracting the year and month from a DateTime) to every element in an array (in this case, every row of the DataFrame).

You can use it like this:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2021, 3, 1), DateTime(2022, 4, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with values [202103, 202204] respectively.
